edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent

Class Time

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.Time

  • public class Time
extends java.lang.Object
    Static class to keep track of time. All values returned by public methods are in seconds, unless stated otherwise.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Time() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getRealTimePassed()
      Real time in seconds elapsed since the previous frame.
      static double getRealTimeSinceStartup()
      Real time in seconds since the game started.
      static double getTime()
      Game time in seconds since the game started.
      static double getTimePassed()
      Game time in seconds elapsed since the previous frame.
      static double getTimeRate()
      Rate of game time relative to real-time.
      static void setTimeRate(double rate)
      Sets the rate of game time relative to real-time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Time

        public Time()

    • Method Detail

      • getTime

        public static double getTime()
        Game time in seconds since the game started.
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • getTimePassed

        public static double getTimePassed()
        Game time in seconds elapsed since the previous frame.
        Returns:
        time in seconds since last frame, typically around 0.03-0.05 for a ~30 fps game. This may vary dramatically depending on the processing speed of the computer, and the number and complexity of objects in the game.

      • getRealTimeSinceStartup

        public static double getRealTimeSinceStartup()
        Real time in seconds since the game started.
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • getRealTimePassed

        public static double getRealTimePassed()
        Real time in seconds elapsed since the previous frame.
        Returns:
        time in seconds

      • getTimeRate

        public static double getTimeRate()
        Rate of game time relative to real-time. I.e, a time rate of 0.5 indicates that the game is running at half-speed (in slow motion).
        Returns:
        ratio of virtual seconds over real seconds

      • setTimeRate

        public static void setTimeRate(double rate)
        Sets the rate of game time relative to real-time. I.e, a time rate of 0.5 indicates that the game is running at half-speed (in slow motion).
        Parameters:
        rate - ratio of virtual seconds over real seconds
